name: Blueberry
description:
Blueberry, Sproutling No. 6
One of a kind mixed media art doll.
9 inches tall from hat tip to toes.

Blueberry was created using air dry clay and a dry felting technique called needle felting. He has a wire armature inside of him that allows for gentle posing. No molds or patterns of any kind were used to make Blueberry. He is truly unique!

Blueberry will come to you carefully packed with a Certificate of Authenticity and a copy of the Sproutling Care Guide.


What are Sproutlings?

Sproutlings are anthropomorphic seed-like creatures with a woolly seed pod that they wear as clothing. Their pointed fingers and toes act like roots, drawing nutrition from soil. They can eat food to supplement their diets which allows them to be highly mobile and survive in many different environments. They are largely vegetarian, but will also eat insects. They have bright, reflective eyes that allow them to see well in the dark. In the wild, Sproutlings dig burrows to live in with their long arms and claw-like hands.

Urban development has pushed a lot of Sproutlings out of their native forest homes, but many have adapted to living in gardens where the soil is packed with nutrients. Not only is having a Sproutling in your garden considered good luck, they keep pests under control and care for the plants. It is customary to leave out sweets or milk for Sproutlings as an offering in exchange for a healthy and beautiful garden.

Sproutlings can understand human speech, but cannot speak it. They can vocalize in small peeps and whistles, but often prefer to listen with their large ears. While Sproutlings all look generally the same, you can tell males from females pretty easily. Males have pointed ears that tend to stick up or out and females have rounded ears that tend to hang down.

Spoutlings make excellent companions and do well indoors if they are well tended to. Just be sure to supply them with a healthy diet of fruits, veggies, and whole grains and allow them to play in your garden from time to time. They are communal creatures, so getting your Sproutling a friend is highly recommended.


• Notice •
Sproutlings can stand and/or sit on their own with a bit of careful balancing. They are top heavy so I do not recommend leaving them standing or sitting unsupervised without the support of a doll stand.

Please keep your Sproutling away from moisture. The clay I use is paper based and will dissolve if it gets significantly wet.

My dolls are delicate art pieces that are meant for display purposes only. They are not intended as playthings for children.

Copyright © 2012 Megan Baehr. All rights reserved.

name: PRE-ORDER Nonesuch Cephalopods
description: from the briny deep hail these tentacled cuties cephalopod friends Nonesuch Garden would love to reintroduce octopuses and squids to the Nonesuch Doll line up! Unfortunately, the patterns have been lost to Davy Jones' Locker and need to be remade. To make this happen, Nonesuch Garden is looking for a few brave buccaneers to pre-order some of these salty friends in order to buy supplies and time to work out the new patterns. The new octopuses and squids will closely resemble the ones pictured in shape and design. They will be made of solid colored merino wool felt and arrive beautifully packaged in an official Nonesuch Garden box with a Certificate of Authenticity. I'm expecting to price the final dolls at or around $65. Get one now for the introductory price of $50. There are a limited number of pre-order slots for both designs, so suction one up while you can! Please choose between a cutie octopus or squid friend! After you click "CHECKOUT" from your shopping cart and have signed in to PayPal, you should see a line that reads, "Note to seller: Add". Click "Add" and let me know your color choices for the Body, Belly, and Eyes of your cephalopod. If you don't have a preference, please write, "Surprise me!" If you can't figure out how to add a note, please contact me with your order number and name in the subject line to let me know your preferences. Click here to view a larger image of the felt colors. THIS IS A PRE-ORDER. Dolls ordered during this pre-order will begin shipping in February 2014 and be filled in the order in which they are received. Please be prepared for a long wait! **These dolls WILL NOT be shipped in time for the holidays.** Since these dolls are already discounted, no other coupons or promotional offers can be applied. Thank you for your understanding. • Notice • My dolls are delicate art pieces that are meant for display purposes only. They are not intended as playthings for children. Handmade with love in Southern Vermont, USA. The Nonesuch Dolls are Copyright © 2008 - 2013 Megan Baehr. All rights reserved.

name: Best Bear No. 7
description:
This one of a kind yellow teddy bear is a collectible designer plush art doll. He is made of merino wool felt and stands approximately 4.75 inches (12cm) tall. His arms and legs are string jointed and can be gently posed. He will arrive beautifully packaged in an official Nonesuch Garden box with a Certificate of Authenticity.

Best Bear No. 7
Edition: OOAK
Birthday: 10/25/2013

Protecting the environment is very important to Nonesuch Garden! The Best Bears are made from wool felt scraps left over from the creation of other Nonesuch Dolls. These unique little teddy bears help reduce waste while being oh so cute and collectible! No two bears will ever be alike.

name: Yellow Sproutling Brooch
description:
Brooch No. 4 - Yellow Sproutling
One of a kind mixed media brooch.
Approx. 2 inches tall by 1 inch wide.

This little piece of wearable art was created using air dry clay and a dry felting technique called needle felting. No molds or pattens of any kind were used to make this one of a kind brooch. She is truly unique! Her reflective glass eyes shift from purple to blue for an eye catching bit of sparkle! Her yellow felted hat is pleasantly soft to the touch and oh so adorable. Pin her to your cardigan, scarf, or hat for a cute and fanciful fashion statement! She would even look great on your book bag or hanging on your wall at home.

• Notice • 
Please keep your Sproutling brooch away from moisture. The clay I use is paper based and will dissolve if it gets significantly wet.

My dolls are delicate art pieces that are meant for display purposes only. They are not intended as playthings for children.

Copyright © 2012 Megan Baehr. All rights reserved.

name: Sproutling Keychain
description:
This one of a kind wooden keychain is laser engraved with an adorable Sproutling and then hand-colored with artist markers. The colors are sealed with satin gloss varnish and the eyes are dotted with gloss varnish for a glimmer of life!

The badge is 1.25 x 2 inches. A 4 inch ball chain is included.

Carry a little Sproutling with you wherever you go!

name: Craftomix, Volume 1 Issues
description:
Craftomix, Crafts and Comics for Everyone! is a monthly collection of crafty goodness, self-published by yours truly and mailed straight to your eager hands. A warmer approach than an e-mail newsletter, this intimate glimpse into the goings on at Nonesuch Garden along with fun activities, artist interviews, poetry, comics, and more is sure to put a smile on your face!

<hr>

Issue 1, May 2013
Theme: Sewing

Table of Contents
- Featured Article: Why Everyone Should Learn to Sew
- Activity: Needle Threading Tips & Basic Stitches
- Comic Strip: Salamander Crossing
- Ask Megan: How Did You Come Up With the Name "Nonesuch Garden"?
- Featured Nonesuch Doll: Dandy the Lion
- Fan Art: Norbert, by Finn

5.5" x 8.5" zine, 8 black and white interior pages printed on recycled paper, pastel yellow card stock cover.

<hr>

Issue 2, June 2013
Themes: Quit Your Day Job, Small Business

Table of Contents
- Featured Article: Nonesuch Garden Turns Five!
- Comic Strip: Create Your Own Destiny
- Special Feature: Studio Tour
- Featured Nonesuch Doll: Bygone the Dragon

5.5" x 8.5" zine, 8 black and white interior pages printed on recycled paper, pastel green card stock cover.

<hr>

Issue 3, July 2013
Theme: Teddy Bears

Table of Contents
- Featured Article: Teddy's Bear to Teddy Bear
- Comic Strip: Teddy Tantrum
- Featured Nonesuch Doll: Meili the Panda

5.5" x 8.5" zine, 8 black and white interior pages printed on recycled paper, pastel pink card stock cover.

<hr>

Issue 4, August 2013
Themes: Needle Felting, Sproutlings

Table of Contents
- Activity: Needle Felting 101
- Comic: Little Sprout Lost (Part 1)
- Featured Article: What Are Sproutlings?
- Fan Art: Flower Power, by Glenn

5.5" x 8.5" zine, 8 black and white interior pages printed on recycled paper, pastel blue card stock cover.

<hr>

Issue 5, September 2013
Theme: Art Therapy

Table of Contents
- Featured Article: When Word Are Not Enough by Dr. Dunn-Snow
- Ask Megan: What Inspired the Sproutlings?
- Comic: Little Sprout Lost (Part 2)

5.5" x 8.5" zine, 8 black and white interior pages printed on recycled paper, marigold card stock cover.

<hr>

Issue 6, October 2013
Theme: Halloween

Table of Contents
- Comic: Little Sprout Lost (Part 3)
- Featured Nonesuch Dolls: Spooky the Cat, Eerie the Owl, and Weenie the Bat
- Do it Yourself: Tiny Bat Friend! Pattern & Instructions

5.5" x 8.5" zine, 8 black and white interior pages printed on recycled paper, bright orange card stock cover.
